required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determining Shapes and Dimensions of Dental Arches for the Use in Lingual Technique.
clinical_study.official_title: Determining Shapes and Dimensions of Dental Arches for the Use in Lingual Technique.

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to determine the shape and dimension of dental arches from a lingual perspective, and determine shape and size used for lingual Orthodontics.

detailed_description.textblock: The study sample comprised 70 Caucasian Brazilian individuals with normal occlusion and at least four of Andrew's six keys. Maxillary and mandibular dental casts were digitized (3D) and the images were analyzed by Delcam Power SHAPET 2010 software. Landmarks on the lingual surface of teeth were selected to determine the shape and size of dental arches.

primary_outcome.description: describe arch form similar a mushroom arch

arm_group.description: Comprised 70 caucasian Brazilian individuals with normal occlusion and at least four of Andrew's six keys.

intervention.description: The sample comprised maxillary and mandibular dental casts of 70 Caucasian Brazilian individuals (28 men and 42 women) with an average age of 16.4 years, all of which had natural normal occlusion with at least four of the six keys to normal occlusion. 14 The first item of the first key was considered essential for sample selection(Angle Class I molar relationship). Another inclusion criterion was that individuals should be at least 15 years of age with no odontogenic abnormalities and all permanent teeth in occlusion.

biospec_descr.textblock: the study sample comprised 70 caucasian brazilian individuals with normal occlusion and at least four of Andrew's six keys.

study_pop.textblock: 70 Caucasian Brazilian individuals (28 men and 42 women) with an average age of 16.4 years

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:criterion was that individuals should be at least 15 years of age all permanent teeth in occlusion -
Exclusion Criteria:with no odontogenic abnormalities

results_reference.citation: Lombardo L, Saba L, Scuzzo G, Takemoto K, Oteo L, Palma JC, Siciliani G. A new concept of anatomic lingual arch form. Am J Orthod Dentofacial Orthop. 2010 Sep;138(3):260.e1-260.e13; discussion 260-1. doi: 10.1016/j.ajodo.2010.04.022.

patient_data.ipd_description: The 70 pairs of cast models were digitized with a 3D Dental Wings™ Scanner (model DW5-140, Montreal, Quebec, Canada). Images were analyzed by Delcam Power SHAPE™ software (2010, Birmingham, UK).
